alert.note: Alert for Butler; Grayson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Butler and southwestern Grayson Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Morgantown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Grayson and northeastern Butler Counties, including the following locations... Banock, Flener, Tilford, Caneyville, Brooklyn, Neafus, Lee, Gilstrap, Decker and Ready. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and central Kentucky.
